column4: 先の戦い、お主らだそうだな。
column5: You looked like you had total control over that last battle.
column11: It looked liked you had total control over that last battle.

column4:
ああ。
人形に乗っていたのは、
この/pだ。
column5: Oh, that was /p piloting the Puppet.
column11: Oh, that was /p piloting the mech.

column4: 十文字＿ちょっとした驚き

まさか、里を救ったのが、
こんな子供だったとは……。
column5: I never would have believed such a small child could have been the savior of the village.
column11: I never would have believed such a small child could have been the saviour of the village.

column4:
拙者、十文字禅岳（ぜんがく）。
こう見えて人形師だ。
column5: I'm Zengaku Cross. Despite my looks, I'm a Puppetmaker.
column11: I'm Zengaku Cross. Despite how it looks, I'm a Puppet Maker.

column4:
おお！
名前は聞いてるぜ。

それにしても……
お主ら、その若さで実に見事な
人形さばきだった。
column5: Even so...I misjudged you. You truly are a master Puppeteer, young'un.
column11: Even so... I misjudged you. This young'un truly is a master puppeteer.

column4: 里を救ってくれて礼を言う。
column5: You have my thanks for saving the village.
column11: You have my thanks for saving the village.

column5: That's very kind of you to say.
column11: That's very kind of you to say.

column4:
礼といってはなんだが、
いつか、お主らのために
人形を作ってやろう。
column5: So how about I show my gratitude by making a Puppet for you sometime?
column11: So how about I show my gratitude by making a mech for you sometime?

column4:
とはいえ、
拙者は工房を持たぬ身。
いつとは約束できぬがな。
column5: I don't have a workshop to call my own, though, so I can't make any promises as to when that might be.
column11: Although, I don't have a Workshop to call my own, so I can't make any promises as to when that might be.

column4:
ははは。
では、また会おう。
column5:
Ha-ha-ha!
Well then, until next we meet!
column11:
Hah hah hah.
Well then, until next we meet.
